attributes.description:
Riders looking to exit the Red Line at Central should exit at Kendall. Shuttle pick-up is located at Main St near station entrance for Alewife platform. Riders looking to board at Central should use shuttle service to Kendall. Shuttle pick-up is located on Mass Ave near Elevator 861. Please see an MBTA employee or access a station call box to request shuttle at both Central and Kendall.

Central Elevator 861 (Ashmont/Braintree platform to street)

attributes.description:
Shuttle buses replace trains as we upgrade tracks and signals along the D Branch. Please plan for additional travel time. All buses are accessible for persons with disabilities.

No Shuttles at Beaconsfield: 
Why do shuttles skip Beaconsfield? Due to narrow roads near Beaconsfield, shuttles cannot safely stop there. 
We recommend: 
- Taking the Green Line C branch from Dean Road, about a 4-minute walk from Beaconsfield 
- Accessing the Green Line D shuttle from Reservoir, about a 10-minute walk from Beaconsfield 

Affected Stops:
Kenmore
Fenway
Longwood
Brookline Village
Brookline Hills
Beaconsfield
Reservoir

attributes.description:
The garage will remain open during construction, and more parking is also available at Quincy Adams and in 2 surface lots at Braintree.

Riders can consider parking at the Quincy Adams Garage. Follow @mbta_parking on Twitter for real-time availability reports weekday mornings.

More than 300 spots are also available at Braintree Station in 2 surface lots off of Ivory Street.
attributes.header: Beginning February 10, 2020 up to 400 of the 1,197 parking spots at the Braintree Garage will close for concrete replacement. This project acceleration will allow the spaces to open 16 months earlier than planned. https://www.mbta.com/south-shore-garages

attributes.description:
During garage construction, 592 spots at the North Quincy Hancock Street lot will be unavailable. More than 600 spots will be available in two surface lots: 
350 spots at Newport Avenue lot 
260 spots at Hancock Street lot 

On weekdays, the Hancock Street lot typically fills by about 7:30 AM, and the Newport Avenue lot fills between 7:45 & 8 AM.

Alternative parking and travel options include: 
403 spots at Wollaston Station during the station closure, with free shuttle service between North Quincy, Quincy Center, and Wollaston Stations.

For more information visit: www.mbta.com/northquincy
attributes.header: Parking has been reduced in the North Quincy Hancock Street Parking Lot to 260 parking spots due to construction of a new garage and mixed retail and residential use building.
attributes.short_header: Parking has been reduced in the N Quincy Hancock St Parking Lot to 260 parking spots due to construction.

attributes.description:
Passengers should allow approximately 30 minutes of travel time between North Station and Porter Square utilizing the subway. There will be no direct connection. 

Normal train service will operate on the Fitchburg Line on Saturday, February 15 and Sunday, February 16. 

Additional weekend may be added to the service change between North Station and Porter Square. Visit mbta.com/FBGwork fr more information.

Outbound trains will depart at their scheduled time from Porter Square. Inbound Fitchburg Line trains will terminate at Porter Square where passengers can connect to the Red Line or a shuttle for service to Boston. Passengers desiring outbound Fitchburg Line service from Boston must take the subway to Porter Square or a bus at Harvard Square for a for a commuter rail connection:

-On February 15-16, a Red Line connection will be provided. 
-On february 29-March 1, March 21-22 and March 28-29, a bus connection will be offered for a Red Line connection at Hardvard Square.
attributes.header: On weekends, Feb 29-Mar 1, Mar 21-22 and Mar 28-29, Fitchburg Line service is suspended in both directions between Porter Square & North Station for Green Line Ext work. A shuttle bus or Red Line connection will be provided at Porter Square.
attributes.short_header: On weekends, Feb 29-Mar 1, Mar 21-22 & Mar 28-29, Fitchburg service is suspended both ways between Porter Sq & N Station for Green Ln Ext

attributes.description:
Please visit https://www.mbta.com/WORwork for more details about bus shuttle schedules. Visit MBTA.com/PTC for more information on how this project will improve commuter rail safety and travel. 

Shuttles are accessible but bicycles will not be allowed on board.

There will be no bus shuttle service to and from South Station. If you are travelling outbound, please use the red Line or the Silver Line to board a Worcester/Framingham shuttle at Back Bay. From Back Bay please board the Orange Line, the Franklin Line, the Needham Line (Saturday only) or the Providence Line for continued service inbound to South Station.

Bus shuttles will not serve Auburndale, West Newton, Newtonville, Boston Landing, Lansdowne stations, please consider the following alternatives:
-Auburndale: Riverside Station  on the Green Line
-West Newton: Bus Route 553 (Saturday only) 
-Newtonville: Bus Route 59 (Saturday& Sunday), 553 (Saturday only)
-Boston Landing: Bus route 57, 64, 66
-Lansdowne: Kenmore or Fenway Station on the Green Line or Bus Routes 8, 57, 60 (Saturday & Sunday), 65 (Saturday only)

Regular train service will operate on March 14-15

Additional weekends may be added to the train service suspension as work progresses on the Worcester line. 

Thank you for your patience while we improve the signal system on your Commuter Rail line.
attributes.header: Weekends, Feb 29 through May, buses replace Worcester Line service between Back Bay and Framingham to connect with regular train service while PTC is installed. No service at Auburndale, W. Newton, Newtonville, Boston Landing, Lansdowne or South Station.
attributes.short_header: Weekends, Feb 29 through May, buses replace Worcester Ln between Back Bay & Framingham to connect with regular train service.

attributes.header: The Beacon Street entrance to Lansdowne Station is closed until mid-March, due to the Fenway Center Construction Project. Access will be available via Maitland Street and David Ortiz Drive. An update will be provided as soon as the entrance reopens.
attributes.short_header: The Beacon St entrance to Lansdowne Sta is closed until mid-March. Access will be available viaMaitland Street and David Ortiz Drive.

attributes.description:
Additional weekends may be added to the train service suspension between Forge Park/495 and Readville as work progresses on the Franklin line.

Please visit mbta.com/FRKwork for more details about bus shuttle schedules. Visit mbta.com/PTC for more information on how this project will improve commuter rail safety and travel. Passengers may experience delays of up to 30 minutes as a result of shuttle bus connections. 

There will be no Franklin line service at Back Bay and Ruggles stations on weekends. Please travel to South Station to reach a Franklin Line station. If you are travelling inbound, please board a Worcester/Framingham line Train for direct connection to Back Bay or a Providence/Stoughton line Train for a direct connection to Back Bay or Ruggles. 

We also recommend the subway: board the Red Line at South Station and transfer to the Orange Line at Downtown Crossing to reach Back Bay or Ruggles. 

Due to proximity of adjacent stations, bus shuttles will not serve Endicott, Islington and Norwood Depot stations: 
-Endicott station customers, please use Readville or Dedham Corp stations. 
-Islington station customers, please use Dedham Corp station. 
-Norwood Depot customers, please use Norwood Central or Dedham Corp station. 

8:40pm and 10:40pm departures from Forge Park as well as 11:20pm departure from South Station will be accommodated by a bus for the entire trip between South Station and Forge Park (including the portion between South Station and Readville). 

Thank you for your patience while we improve the signal system on your Commuter Rail line.
attributes.header: Weekends, through March, Franklin Train service is replaced by free buses between Forge Park/495 and Readville for a Fairmount Line connection while PTC is installed. There will be no service at Back Bay, Ruggles, Endicott, Islington and Norwood Depot.
attributes.short_header: Weekends, through Mar, Franklin Trn service is replaced by free buses between Forge Park & Readville for a Fairmount Ln connection

attributes.description:
Orange Line: Bus shuttle is available upon request to/from Ruggles and Jackson.

Request the shuttle from an MBTA employee or station call box. These elevators are closed through Summer 2020.

Traveling to Ruggles: 
Riders looking to travel to Ruggles should take the train to Jackson Square where a shuttle bus will bring them to Ruggles. The Jackson Square shuttle pick-up location is in the busway adjacent to the station entrance to the mezzanine.

Traveling from Ruggles:
Riders looking to board at Ruggles can use a shuttle bus to Jackson Square or accessible van service in the cul-de-sac adjacent to the station entrance on Forsyth St. The elevator bus pick-up location is in the Ruggles Upper Busway. Riders boarding the accessible van at the Forsyth St. entrance may be transported directly to Jackson Square Station upon request.


Affected elevators:
Elevator 850 Orange Line platform to upper lobby
Elevator 851 Forsyth St to upper lobby
attributes.header: There is no elevator access at Ruggles from the Orange Line or Forsyth St (Northeastern Campus) while the elevators are being replaced. Bus shuttles are available for passengers traveling to/from Ruggles. Access is available from Commuter Rail.
attributes.short_header: There is no elev. access at Ruggles from the Orange Ln or Forsyth St while the elevators are being replaced. Bus shuttles are available.

attributes.description:
From Route 3, drivers can continue straight on Union Street and use the left 2 lanes to turn left onto Ivory Street. From Ivory Street, take a right to enter the garage and station area. For the drop-off/pick-up area, follow signs to the 2nd level of the garage.

Access for RIDE vans and other ADA compliant vans will remain from the ramp to the busway for both parking and drop-offs/pick-ups.

New steps to access the station are scheduled to open on Monday, December 16. New crosswalks and access improvements will be in place as well. 

The Route 3 flyover ramp to the 2nd level of the Braintree Garage is closed due to construction for the South Shore Parking Garages Improvements and Renovations Project. Learn more at: https://www.mbta.com/south-shore-garages

attributes.description:
Due to MassDOT's Tobin Bridge/Chelsea Curves Rehabilitation Project, the Route 1 northbound lane closure will be extended through Chelsea and a southbound lane on the Tobin Bridge will be closed effective May 13. We expect this work will cause significant delays to buses on these roads, including Routes 111, 426, and 428.  

For the Route 111, alternate service options include: 
Commuter Rail: For service to downtown Boston and connections to the Green and Orange Lines. Customers may show their CharlieCard to the conductor for travel between Chelsea and North Station, a 10-minute trip. Parking is not available at Chelsea Station. 

Silver Line - SL3: SL3 connects to the Blue Line (via Airport Station), Red Line (via South Station), and the Commuter Rail at Chelsea Station, along with other Silver Line routes. Monthly LinkPasses are valid for travel on the SL3 and subway. Inbound SL3 fares are being waived from Chelsea, Bellingham Square, Box District, and Eastern Ave during construction. 

Subway: For Blue Line service, take bus Routes 114, 116, or 117 to Maverick or the SL3 to Airport Station. For Red Line, take the SL3 to South Station. For Orange Line, take the Routes 110 or 112 to Wellington. Monthly LinkPasses are valid for travel on the SL3 and subway. Monthly local bus passes are not accepted on SL3 or subway. 

For more information on alternate routes and construction, visit www.mbta.com/tobinbridge
attributes.header: Since May 13, delays on the Route 111 bus are expected due to additional lane closures on Route 1 in Chelsea & the Tobin Bridge. Riders are advised to seek alternate routes, especially during peak hours. MBTA.com/tobinbridge

attributes.description:
Due to MassDOT's Tobin Bridge/Chelsea Curves Rehabilitation Project, the Route 1 northbound lane closure will be extended through Chelsea and a southbound lane on the Tobin Bridge will be closed effective May 13. We expect this work will cause significant delays to buses on these roads, including Routes 111, 426, and 428. 

For the Routes 426 & 428, alternate service options include: 
Commuter Rail: For service to downtown Boston and connections to the Green and Orange Lines. Lynn Station (Zone 2 fare) is a 20-minute trip to North Station and daily parking is available for $2. 

Bus Routes: Inner Express Bus Routes 434 or 450, or local bus Routes 455 connect to downtown Boston and the Orange & Green Lines. Monthly Inner Express Bus passes are valid on these routes and local bus routes/subway. 

Subway: For the Orange Line, take the Route 430 bus from Saugus to Malden Center. For the Blue Line, take local bus Routes 110, 116, 117, 411, 424, 429, 441, 442, 455 or Inner Express Route 426W to Wonderland Station. Monthly Inner Express Bus pass valid for travel on subway and local bus. 

For more information on alternate routes and construction, visit www.mbta.com/tobinbridge
attributes.header: Since May 13, delays on the Routes 426 & 428 are expected due to additional lane closures on Route 1 in Chelsea & the Tobin Bridge. Riders are advised to seek other routes, especially during peak hours. MBTA.com/tobinbridge

attributes.description: Additional weekends may be added to the shuttle busing between Anderson/Woburn and North Station as work progresses on the Green Line Extension project.

attributes.description: If exiting at Central Square, exit the Red Line at Harvard Square and take a Route 1 bus to return to Central or exit at Kendall Station & use shuttle bus service to Central. Shuttle pick-up is on Main St. near the station entrance for the Alewife platform. Please see station personnel or use a station call box to request the shuttle. If boarding at Central, use the shuttle bus for service to Kendall Station. The shuttle pick-up location is on Massachusetts Ave. near Elevator 861.

attributes.description: Riders who need an elevator at Quincy Center should get off of at Wollaston, where an accessible van will take them back to Quincy Center. Riders may also take the accessible van from Quincy Center to Wollaston to board the Red Line. Passengers can also use Bus Routes 210, 211, 212, or 215 for connections between Quincy Center and North Quincy.

attributes.description:
Please plan for extra travel time. All buses are fully accessible. Please see an MBTA employee for assistance.

No Shuttles at Beaconsfield:
Why do shuttles skip Beaconsfield? Due to narrow roads near Beaconsfield, shuttles cannot safely stop there. 
We recommend:
- Taking the Green Line C branch from Dean Road, about a 4-minute walk from Beaconsfield
- Accessing the Green Line D shuttle from Reservoir, about a 10-minute walk from Beaconsfield

Affected stops:

Kenmore
Fenway
Longwood
Brookline Village
Brookline Hills
Beaconsfield
Reservoir

attributes.description:
The shuttle buses between West Gloucester and Rockport will operate near normal train schedule on that weekend.

Bicycles are not permitted on shuttle buses.

For more info, visit mbta.com/RKPwork.

attributes.header: On Saturday, Feb 22 & Sunday, Feb 23, shuttle buses will replace Rockport Line service between W. Gloucester & Rockport for work on the Gloucester Drawbridge. Passengers may experience a 5-15 minute delay departing W. Gloucester due to the bus connection.
attributes.short_header: On Sat, Feb 22 & Sun, Feb 23, shuttle buses will replace Rockport Ln between W Gloucester & Rockport for work on the Gloucester Drawbridge.

attributes.header: Route 72 trips at 7:45am, 8:15, 8:45, and 9:15 will have a schedule adjustment and run 10 minutes later starting on Monday February 3 and continuing for the remainder of the winter and spring schedules to improve coordination with Route 75 on Huron Ave.
